titles.title: A concurrent resolution permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to commemorate the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S2362)
Referred to the Committee on Rules.

calendar.text: Committee on Rules. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Rules. Reported to Senate by Senator Ford without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 39.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Frost asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
The House struck all after the enacting clause and inserted in lieu thereof the provisions of a similar measure H. Con. Res. 41. Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
A similar measure H. Con. Res. 41 was laid on the table without objection.
The title of the measure was amended to that of similar measure H. Con. Res. 41. Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendments by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/23/1993--Passed House amended. Allows use of the rotunda of the Capitol on April 20, 1993, and April 6, 1994, for ceremonies to observe the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.
